meanings.sent1: The virulences of the virus made it very dangerous.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the virulences of different strains of bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The competition between the two viruses for the most virulences was fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her words were filled with the virulences of anger and resentment.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of war carried the virulences of destruction and chaos.

meanings.definition: The degree of pathogenicity of a microorganism.
meanings.sent1: The virulences of the bacteria determined how harmful it was.
meanings.sent2: Doctors analyzed the virulences of the virus to understand its impact.
meanings.sent3: The tiny microorganism boasted about its high virulences to the other cells.
meanings.sent4: The virulences of the virus spread rapidly through the population.
meanings.sent5: The virulences of the pathogen were evident in the severity of the illness it caused.

meanings.definition: The ability of a microorganism to cause disease.
meanings.sent1: The virulences of the virus led to an outbreak of illness.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the virulences of the bacteria helped in developing treatments.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky microorganism used its virulences to outsmart the immune system.
meanings.sent4: The virulences of the pathogen were like a silent assassin in the body.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained the virulences of the virus to the worried patient.
